member.name: T:org.albertschmitt.crypto.RSAService
member.summary: This class implements RSA private/public key encryption with a 2048 bit key using the Bouncy Castle API. Clients can use this class to easily incorporate encryption into their applications. Note when converting between strings and byte arrays clients should be sure to convert using the UTF-8 character set. External Dependencies: Bouncy Castle Release 1.7

member.name: F:org.albertschmitt.crypto.RSAService.RSA_2K
member.summary: 2048 bit key size.

member.name: F:org.albertschmitt.crypto.RSAService.RSA_3K
member.summary: 3072 bit key.

member.name: F:org.albertschmitt.crypto.RSAService.RSA_4K
member.summary: 4096 bit key size.

member.name: M:org.albertschmitt.crypto.RSAService.#ctor
member.summary: Create an instance of the class using a 2048 bit key.

member.name: M:org.albertschmitt.crypto.RSAService.getRSAKeySize
member.summary: Returns the RSA key size. This is a protected function so the programmer can changed the default key size to 4096 bits by sub-classing this RSAService and using #setRSAKeySize(int key_size) in the constructor to change it.
member.returns: The key size.

member.name: M:org.albertschmitt.crypto.RSAService.setRSAKeySize(System.Int32)
member.summary: Inherit from this class and call this function in the constructor to set the key size if you want it to be 3072 or 4096 bits instead of the default.

member.name: M:org.albertschmitt.crypto.RSAService.concatenate(System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Concatenate two byte arrays together.
member.returns: Byte array containing First + Second byte array.

member.name: M:org.albertschmitt.crypto.RSAService.AsymmetricBlockCipher(org.albertschmitt.crypto.Key,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Return an IAsymmetricBlockCipher for encryption or decryption.
member.returns: The block cipher.
member.param: true if encrypting, false if decrypting.
member.returns: IAsymmetricBlockCipher configured to encrypt or decrypt.

member.name: M:org.albertschmitt.crypto.RSAService.doCipher(System.Byte[],org.albertschmitt.crypto.Key,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Encrypt or decrypt a stream and send the result to an output stream. TBD explain data size limit and why we're using a loop to get around it.
member.param: true to encrypt, false to decrypt.
member.returns: The encrypted data.

member.name: M:org.albertschmitt.crypto.RSAService.doCipher(System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream,org.albertschmitt.crypto.Key,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Encrypt or decrypt a stream and send the result to an output stream.
member.param: The input stream to be encrypted.
true to encrypt, false to decrypt.

member.summary: Encode the byte data and return it in an byte array.
member.param: The byte array to be encoded.
member.returns: The RSA encoded data.

member.summary: Encode the String and return it in an byte array.

member.summary: Decode the RSA encoded byte data and return it in an byte array.

member.summary: Decode the RSA encoded String and return it in an byte array.

member.summary: Decode the RSA encoded input stream and return it in an output stream.

member.summary: Construct a Public Key from an AsymmetricCipherKeyPair and write it to the Output Stream.

member.summary: Generate a Public / Private RSA key pair and write them to the designated file names.

The stream to which the RSA Public Key will be written.

member.name: M:org.albertschmitt.crypto.RSAService.areKeysPresent(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Checks for the existence of the RSA Private and Public Key and returns true if they exist or false if they don't.
member.param: The file containing the RSA Private Key.
The file containing the RSA Public Key.
member.returns: true if the key pair exist false if they do not.

member.name: T:org.albertschmitt.crypto.AESService
member.summary: This class implements AES 256-bit encryption using the Bouncy Castle API which gets around the 128-bit limitation imposed by the java runtime. Clients can use this class to easily incorporate encryption into their applications. Note when converting between strings and byte arrays clients should be sure to convert using the UTF-8 character set. External Dependencies: Bouncy Castle Release 1.7

members.member: * The size in bytes of the salt.

member.name: M:org.albertschmitt.crypto.AESService.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

members.member:
* Returns the AES key size. This is a protected function so the programmer * can changed the default key size to 128 bits by sub-classing this * AESService and using #setAESKeySize(int key_size) in the constructor to * change it. * * @return The key size.
Gets the size of the AES key. This is a protected function so the programmer can changed the default key size to 128 bits by sub-classing this AESService and using #setAESKeySize(int key_size) in the constructor to change it.
The AES key size.

member.name: M:org.albertschmitt.crypto.AESService.setAESKeySize(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the size of the AES key. Inherit from this class and call this function in the constructor to set the key size if you want it to be 128 bits instead of the default.
member.param: he desired AES key size. Only 128 and 256 are valid.

member.name: M:org.albertschmitt.crypto.AESService.concatenate(System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Concatenate two byte arrays together.
member.returns: Byte array containing First + Second byte array.

member.name: M:org.albertschmitt.crypto.AESService.getCipher(System.Byte[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Return a IBufferedCipher for encryption or decryption.
member.param: forEncryption true to encrypt, false to decrypt.
member.returns: IBufferedCipher configured to encrypt or decrypt

member.name: M:org.albertschmitt.crypto.AESService.encode(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Encode the byte data to AES256 and return it in byte array.
member.returns: AES256 encoded byte array of input data.

member.name: M:org.albertschmitt.crypto.AESService.encode(System.String)
member.summary: Encode the String to AES256 and return it in byte array.
member.returns: AES256 encoded byte array of input data.

member.name: M:org.albertschmitt.crypto.AESService.decode(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Decode the AES256 encoded byte data and return it in an byte array.
member.returns: Decoded byte array of AES256 encoded input data.

member.name: M:org.albertschmitt.crypto.AESService.decode(System.String)
member.summary: Decode the AES256 encoded String and return it in an byte array.
member.returns: Decoded byte array of AES256 encoded input data.

member.name: M:org.albertschmitt.crypto.AESService.doCipher(System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream,Org.BouncyCastle.Crypto.IBufferedCipher)
member.summary: Encrypt or decrypt a stream and send the result to an output stream.
member.param: The input stream to be encrypted.
A PaddedBufferedBlockCipher configured to encrypt or decrypt.

member.name: M:org.albertschmitt.crypto.AESService.encode(System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Encode the input stream to AES256 and return it in an output stream.
member.param: AES256 encoded output stream of input stream.

member.name: M:org.albertschmitt.crypto.AESService.decode(System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Decode the AES256 encoded input stream and return it in an output stream.
member.param: AES256 encoded input stream to be decoded.
Decoded output stream of input stream.

member.name: M:org.albertschmitt.crypto.AESService.generateKey
member.summary: Generate an AES key. A key generated by this method would typically be encrypted using RSA and sent to the recipient along with data that was encrypted with the key. The recipient would then decrypt the key using RSA then use the key to decrypt the data.

member.name: M:org.albertschmitt.crypto.AESService.generateKey(System.String,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Generate an AES key using a given password and salt.
member.param: The password to be used to create the key.
The 32 byte long array to be used to create the key.

member.name: M:org.albertschmitt.crypto.AESService.generateSalt
member.summary: Generate a salt value using SecureRandom() that can be used to generate an AES256 key. The salt is 32 bytes in length.
member.returns: Byte array containing the salt.

member.name: M:org.albertschmitt.crypto.AESService.getAesKey
member.summary: Get the AES key that was created by generateKey() or generateKey(String password, byte[] salt)
member.returns: Byte array containing the AES key.

member.name: M:org.albertschmitt.crypto.AESService.setAesKey(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Sets the AES key that was retrieved by the getAesKey() method.
member.param: Byte array containing the AES key.

member.name: T:org.albertschmitt.crypto.Compare
member.summary: Cryptographically safe comparison functions. These functions should take the same time to complete regardless if they evaluate to true or false. That way, attackers can gain no additional information when hacking.

member.name: M:org.albertschmitt.crypto.Compare.safeEquals(System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Make sure any compare takes the same amount of time. Prevents timing based attacks.
member.returns: true if byte arrays are equal, false if not.

member.name: T:org.albertschmitt.crypto.Hex
member.summary: Convert byte arrays to hexadecimal strings and visa-versa. This class is useful in situations where you want to store byte data in a text file.

member.name: M:org.albertschmitt.crypto.Hex.decode(System.String)
member.summary: Convert a hexadecimal string back into a byte array. This function reverses the action of the encode(byte data[]) function.

member.name: M:org.albertschmitt.crypto.Hex.encode(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Convert a byte array into a hexadecimal string.
member.param: The byte array to be converted into a hexadecimal string.
